baseline_groups.claim_summary: Closure of the Grand Canal increased rebellion incidence in canal-adjacent counties relative to non-adjacent counties (DiD)
baseline_groups.notes: Five baseline specs corresponding to Table 3 columns 1-5. Col 4 is the preferred specification (full FE, no controls). Col 5 (full FE + all 15 controls) fails with singular matrix error. Outcome: asinh(rebellion onset per 1600 population). Treatment: interaction1 = alongcanal x reform (binary canal proximity x post-closure). Design: TWFE DiD with county and year FE, clustered at county level.

global_notes: Surface-driven run. Single baseline group G1. All planned specs from the surface core_universe were executed (47 total). 16 failures: 4 from singular matrix (col 5 baseline + 3 LOO/set variants with all 15 controls), 11 from duplicate column names in the merged sample-restriction data, and 1 outlier-trim that also hits the duplicate-column bug. No baseline-group reassignment needed. No spurious groups found.
